S4N5271a0WcIvGBqel7n5Q.text: Another favorite Thai restaurant in town. Pad Thai is tasty and delicious. We love the tom yum soup as well. All in all great food and service.

TKmSmSJZvhIM7Q1qRlishQ.text: Our favorite Thai spot! I love that I can easily and quickly order food to-go on their website. The quantity and quality are always on-point, and they remember my husband and me every time we come in. I recently had my baby, and the next time I went in to pick up food, they had a little gift for him-how thoughtful!! Highly recommended!

snBHuF19sDbiRcN5gpAJFQ.text: Delicious food. Friendly service. A great local place to have. My wife said it felt like getting the food you hope for, when ordering Thai.

aL6SLzu-JwriTu42AEYvgw.text: Very underrated delicious Thai food.  Great service and great restaurant.  Don't judge this great place by the older shopping center.

s4HVsRLXXholsGtoAkbc4w.text: Delicious!  So happy to see such a nice little gem of a restaurant on the east side.  Best  Crab Rangoon I've had in ages.  Loved the Red Curry with chicken.  Fresh, quality food perfectly prepared and spiced exactly as requested. We will definitely be back soon.

JeocDGXz_ZrcwfQP4pZ9EQ.text: We've eaten at the restaurant once and ordered delivery 3 times.  I think the people who run it are so friendly and nice.  The restaurant is nicely decorated and clean.  My husband loves the lovely basil tofu dish.  I think the flavors are good and for the most part I have enjoyed my food.  The goyza tonight were super yummy.  But for the second time my order of "mild" level heat was too hot for me to eat even half of my dish.  My husband ordered his hot tonight and tried mine and said he thought mine was hotter.  I ordered the cashew nut dish, and it also didn't have a single cashew in it.  Maybe it's puree in the sauce?  The flavor was good but my lips were too hot for me to enjoy it.   I have learned my lesson and will order "no heat" next time. I do recommend this place, but just caution others who may be heat sensitive like I am.  (Though I've ordered medium at other places and been fine!)

JgHwQIJXVpsYvnEucvI5Hg.text: Believe all the great reviews - they're legit!  Fabulous little place on East Independence.  Absolutely superb crab rangoon, potstickers and pad thai.  Both the rangoon and the potstickers had delightfully thin and crispy wrappers which let the fillings shine.  The lovely hostess also offered a sample of a samosa-like appetizer that was similarly delish!  We are thrilled, thanks to our fellow Yelpers, to have been alerted to this wonderful addition to the asian restaurants in town.  If you're a fan of fresh, flavorful, plentiful asian cuisine served in a friendly and super clean setting, go here soon!!!

wwE8SSs3NfaIBBMvSCSfWQ.text: Tried Aroy Thai for dinner and enjoyed everything!  Service was fast and friendly.  Great for kids- the chicken teriyaki and fried bananas were a big hit with them.  They got the level of spice just right for the dishes we ordered- shrimp red curry and papaya salad.  portions were very generous and we had quite a bit left over to take home for later.  can't wait to come back!

uX3F1rCae3TYh89JZLZg5w.text: Best Thai food I have found in the 16 years I have lived in Charlotte.  My wife and I go there as often as we can and the owners always remember our names. I will be a customer for life.

uZ7FwZA6CIRyAZD6qUvqHw.text: So good! It's the best thai in Charlotte, i wish had the money to invest and get them in a better location because i really want to see them succeed!

DYL8bX6nJUJ0D2EF-A1n2w.text: Authentic piping hot Thai food. We enjoyed our late lunch at Aroy Thai. The owners were extremely courteous and made sure we had everything we needed. They have an interesting and sensible serving style. You get your food in take out containers so it is easier to pack and leave once you are done eating. We will definitely visit again when we visit Charlotte.

v9_Bz0w-Rp23Gq7BhSWKWQ.text: First time, we picked up and took home, but inside looked very nice. Really good food, very hot and a bunch of it. Location is suspect, but worth a try if you like Thai.

G58rzraIlESSf9xaPKqGHw.text: Everything was delicious love this place definitely coming back! Super friendly I got medium pad see ew and it's the perfect spice

mShqw21fhHATAQtvO1Wdmw.text: Aroy Thai was marvelous. Terry and Meghan are very sweet and hospitable. I loved the shrimp Phai Thai. I get it every time. And the Thai tea is my favorite drink. I come here a lot and look forward to coming here more.

qH304R8Yi0uY_YaKqcW-8Q.text: Very good experience all the way around. Clean, delicious and unique flavors. Keep checking with me to see if everything was OK. Offered a free sample of a curry roll. Yummy. The sauces were to die for. Lots of smiles and got vibes. I will go back again.

o2D0-NJFzBO7sMUoDpL7nQ.text: Stopped in for lunch and order the tasty Mao Mao Noodles.  Service was quick and friendly.  The gave me a free sample of Crab Rangoon, which was also very good.  You can customize the spice level.  I went with "hot"and was happy with the level of heat.

AZXJMzSS1eY9sXkaLW34xQ.text: This well may be the best Thai food I have ever had!!!! We tried three appetizers and two entrees and everything was AMAZING! Wow.

cfkMMnDTqwe8UBN9k5Mrwg.text: Great Thai food!! My fiance and I went there on a whim about a week ago just to check it out. We love Thai food and this one's not a hike to get to. Walked in and the owner was very kind. We ordered the chicken pad thai and veggie fried rice and we were amazed! I had actually ordered the veggie pad thai first but the owner was thoughtful enough to inform me that they use fish sauce in making their pad thai so I switched to the fried rice. The veggies were crisp and fresh and didn't feel like someone had defrosted my meal. The flavors were really great as well and they have a fair portion size (I was able to save the rest for lunch the next day)! My fiance had the chicken pad thai and he said that it tasted great, everything was cooked well and the flavor was what he was expecting. We had ordered an app as well, the spring rolls, and they were freshly fried and delicious. The owner even offered for us to try one each of the imitation crab and the curry wraps--both were fantastic.   If you're looking for a place with great food, great flavors, and a good portion size... then I would definitely recommed trying this place out! The prices are pretty standard for a Thai restaurant, but definitely worth it!

7V8v5fNqLXVQW_JM63xQfg.text: My husband and I decided to check out a new spot for date night and we're so glad we did! The first thing we noticed was the squeaky clean space and adorable decor. A smile greeted us as soon as we entered followed up with impeccable service by the owner. He walked us through our vegetarian options and recommended the most delicious cuisines for us to enjoy. And boy did we ever! YUM! I dined on the "vegetable panang curry" while my husband chose the "cashew nuts and more" entree. We also selected the spring rolls and curry puffs for our apps. Luckily they served enough for us to enjoy leftovers tomorrow! We can hardly wait. The owner explained that he and his wife own and operate the restaurant while his mother-in-law whips up their family recipes in the kitchen. And, get this, they try to be eco friendly by serving all meals on compostable plates and use eco friendly utensils and cups. Love it! The concept is fast casual so it's great if you're pressed for time, but also suitable for date night and family affairs too. We were offered the donut dessert, but we simply couldn't fit another bite into our bellies. Next time, for sure! 2 apps + 2 entrees for less than $40.....just do it!

dngdU6HV3krjHYCYn5Nedw.text: Great new Thai restaurant in a shopping center Ive driven past without thought for years. Portions are HUGE and the staff is incredibly friendly. I had the Totally Red Curry, Medium Spice, and it hit the perfect balance of creamy vs spicy with great Thai basil strewn throughout. If you get a curry get a 2nd order of rice though because it is a largeee amount of curry. Pad Thai for my wife (no spice) was a little bland but I usually think that about the dish regardless of preparation. Curry puffs were almost like curry samosas and were a great app.

-lx3cjo86qEveM6DsuaEFg.text: I ordered tonight through door dash and let me tell you how amazing this food was. I got the pad see yew and my family got some of the curry dishes. We know curry as my mother is from India and it was absolutely delicious. I had ordered a Thai coffee and the manager on duty tonight took the courtesy to call me and apologize for they were all out and instead suggested the Thai iced tea... SO GOOD. He even threw in a little moon pie that wrote "thank you sairah".  Now that is customer service. Highly recommend and will make sure to dine in next time

LoV2qSopCtV6gljrYobKMA.text: This place is tucked away in an aging strip mall on Independence but don't let that deter you. The food is amazing, inexpensive, and the owners are arguably just as great (like remember your name and stop to talk to you great)! The interior is pristine and has a cozy, almost "rustic-chic" feel. The food is always fresh, hot, and delicious. I've become a regular here and can't recommend it enough!

PFcEJ33iRnPBf-hPcEgVUQ.text: I was so lucky to find this place in my Thai food search!  When I arrived I was greeted by a young friendly couple. I placed an order to go. As I waited the couple continued to chat with me. As I sat there I noticed the Decor was not traditional Thai however it was very modern/trendy with barn-wood on the walls!  It felt like it was designed by the team at Fixer-Upper on TV! Ha ha The place was very clean! I ordered red curry shrimp which definitely varies from restaurant to restaurant however it was perfect. The shrimp could've been a little larger but the spice was perfect! I also ordered the curry puffs which were perfectly deep fried! I wish this couple the best of luck with their new restaurant! I would highly recommend this place to anyone!

6Gtl3xfOWOyBs1s-NlY6lg.text: Great first time experience at Arroy!! The owners were super friendly, made suggestions and were great people. The two of us ordered a smorgasbord and loved everything. My husband had the Thai Iced tea and the spice tray to add a kick to his entrees. You have to try the curry puffs filled with curry, onion, carrot and potato served with sweet chili sauce. The egg rolls are stuffed with clear noodles and vegetables. Their chicken satay is no served on a stick, but are large tender pieces of breast meat paired with peanut sauce. We never had Tom Kha Kai soup with so many mushrooms, the lemony notes have it a great balance. We also added two entrees (I know, it's a lot) of combination pad Thai and pineapple fried rice, which are some of their top sellers. The pad Thai noodles were smaller than normal which was a nice surprise and we always add garlic to ours. Since it was our first time, they also gave us free fried banana dessert. This cute little egg roll was topped with honey and powdered sugar. They use all disposable products so the food served add your table comes in the take out trays for easy packaging (we had a bag full of leftovers) and your given recycled paper plates and plastic ware. Seemed like a very efficient business model to us. Hope you don't wait long to enjoy for yourself!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Aroy Thai Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Aroy Thai Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Aroy Thai Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

I5LSgl3Z3I6m3k2JFNw7mQ.text: Stopped in based on the rating on yelp Not dissapointed at all.  Fresh hot food.  I would come again

CNQ52XsKQxI-LaEv-XKQJA.text: This is a for a take out order. First time here. We live right down the road, glad there is such great thai food close to us!! The atmosphere was very pleasant, intimate space and lighting. Veeeery clean, and the owners were great! Very happy and informative, just really nice people! They even offered us candies while we waited haha.   I got the pad thai with veggies and tofu. I like the thin rice noodles and lots of sauce! There were plenty of vegetables & tofu!! Huge portions!!! The peanut sauce is rockin as well!!   Thanks a lot! Will return, soon!!!

41lnoHjixME8rM7jjoKkTw.text: One of my favorite new restaurants. Portions are great. Love everything I've tried. We always order extra veggies on a few dishes. Eat in or carry home. Yummie. Enough for lunch the next day. Owners are very kind, special people. Love!

swcfdJ4trk7Z49McqR7WeA.text: Someone bought me take out from here for lunch it's was really good I had the chicken pad Thai and two potstickers came with it I was pleasantly surprised at how much they give you and everything tasted hot and fresh

CCUvZyNbWeZzSm8gP2IjNA.text: Not only great food but AMAZING service!!! The 2 people that helped us were very attentive and friendly.  We will be back.

cH1RT3IY8gyKuKFbV_sRMQ.text: So excited that a Thai restaurant opened close by! Very pleasantly surprised! Interior of the restaurant was very clean and nicely decorated. Staff is extremely helpful and friendly. Ordered the ultimate garlic with pork and kapow fried rice with chicken. Both very flavorful and filled with fresh veggies. Got to sample one of the crab Rangoon appetizer and even though not a fan of cream cheese, it was pretty dang good. Hope this place sticks around!!

Pv5PbXtPBwZjMX9hxh1XMA.text: Stopped by at this joint this eve and tried their penang curry. I was very skeptical about the food initially, but to my surprise, the food was amazing! The owners are very likeable and friendly people, also very hospitable and welcoming. They also gave us complementary curry puffs and aroy thai dessert and both were delicious! The quantity and the price are great too. Will definitely go back for the flavourful penang curry again! Happy tummy, happy me!

68lcNobeUnhMkKk5a_vMaw.text: Finally! I have been in search of a good thai food place since I moved to Charlotte.  After trying several other Thai places I nearly lost hope and then it happened, Aroy! This place has by far the best green curry and pad thai I have EVER eaten, and I've had Thai everywhere from California to New York.  Aroy is seriously the best ever.  I am so happy to have found this place. Thank you for being in Charlotte!!!!

ZYiIWMZza4CgzV-fgHEPXg.text: Awesome service, people were very friendly and pad Thai was great!

bBnUv4YyNqWjUX5TRPWW8g.text: Finally, a Thai restaurant on the East side! Yelp sent us to them! We weren't disappointed! Graciously greeted and served. We stopped in for lunch Saturday afternoon. You're seated and given a menu to look over and once you decide you go to the front counter and place your order and pay. We started with the Curry Puffs and Pak Pak (Papaya) Salad. The Curry Puffs and dipping sauce were so tasty and the Pak Pak was outstanding! The papaya, peanuts, and tomato in the salad were a wonderful sensation of taste and flavor! My wife had the Pad Thai with Tofu (no spice) and the sauce on the noodle was delicious and the tofu cooked perfectly! I had the Panang Curry with chicken (medium) and it was some of the best I've ever had! We both had a Thai Tea (very good) and a fried banana! It was a wonderful lunch.  The lunch specials are perfectly proportioned and priced very reasonably! The husband and wife team were so nice and wonderful to talk with! Mom's in the kitchen cooking and you can tell as it has a home-cooked flavor! We really can't wait to go back and highly recommend that you give them a try!

amkzamJoUe7_EVnlTuhH0w.text: Yay!! A Thai restaurant on the east side! My husband and I just went here for dinner and had a great little date night. We ordered pork dumplings (fried), pad Thai, and green curry. The owners offered to let us try the curry puffs as well. Everything was delicious! In addition to the food being great, the owners here made the experience 5 Star. They make you feel welcome and right at home and you can tell they are genuinely excited to be a part of the Eastland community. Go check this place out and let's all make sure they grow and are here to stay!

uNcE9iNHthLn2ftk3hDEyA.text: Stopped in for lunch today and had a fantastic lunch.  Everything was fresh,  Hot and delicious.   The staff was incredibly friendly, I believe this is a family owned business.  Unfortunately they didn't seem to be doing much of a lunch crowd don't hesitate to go here I'm afraid if they don't get more business they won't be around long  and that would be a shame.

jM-y6QoIpmDciAqnzJBc6Q.text: Awesome food and super friendly owners. Will definitely be back! Their soups are tasty, as are their entrees. We've had their noodle, rice and curry dishes and will try more in the future. The service is also very good and you're made to feel at home!

_2rllvld4JkWlAHeZKXmBg.text: Absolutely delicious Thai food with the friendliest owners! I got the pad Thai and my husband got the basil chicken and steamed dumplings for an app. All so good! We'll be back for sure!

nkZpd9AqPyFAASPoouZREw.text: Aroy has become our go to for Thai takeout. It is always delicious with generous portions. The owner is very kind and the location is convenient. Yum!

Yp8oqo_RwbIUgkB7l_TkOA.text: First off, the owners of this restaurant are so friendly and welcoming! The interior of the restaurant is so modern, cozy and clean. The menu names are so appealing that I will definitely have to try them all soon. I love how they cater the spice level to your taste and the portions are really good for the price. The crab rangoons were really delicious~ aroy! The tom yum was the best I've ever had and their curry was unique to their own. Definitely will come again! Come here and you will leave with a happy stomach!

photos.caption: Photo of Aroy Thai Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ordered a Vegetable and Chicken Pad See Ew, Shrimp Tom Yum, and Red Curry. Plus, their Crab Rangoons was soo delicious.

eqvl0kvyFLVuS-rVJu1EcA.text: This place is wonderful. Very nice service looking to please and make sure you are enjoying your meal. The food is fresh and well prepared. They go beyond to make sure you have a great experience.   Come and enjoy you will agree.

0dTHFueK3dlc0xg8tKqL3g.text: Nice to have a Thai restaurant in East Charlotte. Love the place. Didn't get 5 stars because not all we ordered were perfect. It gets a 4.9   You pick where you want to sit. Someone gives you a menu and tells you how the place work. Once you know what you want, you go to the counter and place your order and pay. They bring out the food in to-go containers. Once you finish, you clear your own table.  Curry puff is a yellow curry veggie filling in a wonton skin, it's fried and comes with a sweet/tangy dipping sauce. Very good. Very original.  Papaya salad was has a tany, sweet and spicy sauce mixed with shredded crunchy green papaya,tomato and peanut. I liked it, husband thought it would be better if less sweet.  Tom yum soup was not to my husband liking. He felt it lacked flavor.  Panang curry is my favorite type of curry, it's the most flavorful out of all curry. A very subtle peanut note. Very good. Had plenty of sauce to take home and mix with rice for lunch.  Pad Thai noodle was the right balance between salt, spicy, tangy, and sweet. Noodle were cooked just right, al dente.   Fried donuts come with a condensed milk sauce. Who knew you can take biscuits, deep fry it and it come out great. I inhaled it in 5 minuets.  Recommend this place. Will come back soon. The young couples are very friendly and great service.

79DYhHxdtMB0FQ31gPmDrA.text: Great Thai food.  We ordered customized (less salty, more sour) dishes to get authentic Thai food. They can made real good one for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Aroy Thai Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Curry Puff appertizer - amazing

Quf4xl7ZFUX-DVqbcEm9_g.text: My pad Thai lacked spice completely (I requested a 3/5 on spice), the crab rangoons were not even close to warm and barely had any crab at all. Being that we got to-go food for a long drive-- we had to throw them out entirely. The order was supposed to take 20 minutes and took 55, and when it came out-- there were no gyozas for the lunch special, and they forgot rice on one of the two platters. We were excited to try this place, and went out of our way to do so. However, I definitely feel like I wasted 35 dollars and don't think we'll be making our way back.

tYS9V9NX1IJfoeYE4tyqjw.text: Family owned! The owner is so nice and welcoming, they just moved from out west to Charlotte. The food is amazing amazing. Restaurant has a casual but nicely decorated dining area. I got the pad see ew with chicken and papaya salad. Get it spicy! Makes the flavor kick. I'm Cambodian and I know my southeast Asian cuisine very well... this Thai restaurant's food is supreme. Tastes like home! Flavor packed and not over cooked or bland. Portions are also large, it could be shared between two people. It is located off the busy 74 freeway but there is an additional lane dedicated to turning into the shopping center so it wasn't that bad entering and exiting the lot. It's off the beaten popular streets of Charlotte but it's so worth it to hit up this place! I know I will be a regular. Give them your business, you won't regret it!

photos.caption: Photo of Aroy Thai Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pok Pok (papaya) Salad!
Photo of Aroy Thai Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pad See Ew with chicken. Amazing!!

L8Y2o3LKPbwuK5PCTpNTEg.text: They need to get a soda machine and decide if they are going to be a take out restaurant or dine in. Ordering at the counter is ok but again are they dine in or take out.  Add for the food out wasn't that good. The pad thai was a pile of super spicy noodles (and we only got medium spice) with no flavor. The red curry, medium spicy was way too spicy a d the flavor levels just weren't there.   We won't be going back. Although the strip club could entice us back.  Haha just kidding that place is way too sketchy.

woBs0Kh0P3OYuDXhqbGMvg.text: The pad Thai here is amazing! I asked for it it be Thai spicy and they actually delivered. Usually there's isn't enough kick to flavor ratio but at Aroy Thai there certainly is! I ordered through door dash and there was even a kit kat taped to my bag. I will be ordering from here more often.

0LpEMJqJ2Ki1hYPV4dyYZA.text: First time here ordered lunch to go. I got shrimp red curry and beef lovely basil added broccoli. The curry was delicious, the lunch portion has 5 shrimps. Medium spicy was not too hot, and I don't like bamboo shoots but they slice them skinny so I liked them. Lunches come with 2 piece gyoza. I will be coming back

photos.caption: Photo of Aroy Thai Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Aroy Thai Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

0xAewJb8mw_CLfgz4PFitQ.text: Not much of a Thai person, but I really enjoyed this! Great service and I enjoyed the food, definitely a sketchy area - in between a lingerie store and club... Will be returning!

JJrURycXdBGvSxQbQ5TClw.text: Loved the food!!!! Excellent and I have been back several times now!!! Owner is awesome and funny and the chief is very friendly!!!!

aB7f3NdyvP5JbURWWju70Q.text: We love this place! Our favorite used to be Monsoon so we have been bummed out since it closed. Now, we have Aroy and let me say it is as good as Monsoon was! Love it! Awesome lunch specials and a great menu! We ordered the pad Thai and the Mao mao (drunken) noodle and they were both excellent! Best Thai food in Charlotte!

0Y2rhefEnzTfOo5KmH3gpA.text: First let me say that the Owners of this restaurant strive to make your experience as perfect as possible. They are great! Very attentive and pleasant! Appetizers are the Star here. We ordered the Curry Puffs, I was excited to try them, they were pretty good. Crisp fried little triangles with a Curry almost samosa like filling. Satee was okay, the peanut sauce was sweet. Crab Rangoon was filled and delicious!   We also ordred the Garlic Pork, which was an entree and that was good, very garlicky and had lots of Mushrooms. We had the Panang Curry, the Sauce was so good I could have done shots of it! Outstanding Curry Sauce, Not too much chicken. Fried Rice was good, but could have been a little more flavorful. We also ordered a dish which was supposed to be very spicy and hot but basically was onions and not very hot. Very clean little place and great owners. They gave us a couple of their deep fried donuts for dessert!  I would go back for the Appetizers and the Curry for sure ! Oh and the Thai Iced Tea was delicious!!

ydWLBRm3GSumi8z5L0sABw.text: A new fave! Super friendly people and delicious food! I loved all of the appetizers. We had the crab Rangoon (full of crab), fried dumplings (Little fried garlic pork meatballs), curry puffs (delish) and chicken satay. Yes. We like apps. Also shared a Lovely Basil Curry and a Garlic Pork. My only recommendation would be just being able to order at the tables versus going up to the counter. Things were fresh and good! All the folks working were super friendly and helpful! We will be back!

wemkkKyy0FCOmaPzGQ9UOA.text: Not a great experience. Maybe the place is under new ownership or the management changed. Significant changes since we were last there. Previously the plateware, cutlery and cups were mostly recyclable products. Now they are plastic. None of it is recycled. No plates to wash to lower costs I'm sure but at least before I felt like my consumption of product would be recycled. Oh and the plastic forks broke and I was unable to finish my meal because I couldn't find the pieces. (Hmm, maybe I'll bring my own metal cutlery next time.) The (2) waters arrived with ice in the cup accompanied by little specs of 'flavor' in the water. That was gross. I ordered a very simple shrimp pad Thai. Previously when I ordered it the noodles we're longer then 3 inches AND the taste of so much ketchup was absent. Maybe the recipe changed slightly? My partners red curry also tasted of ketchup. I don't make Thai food but I didn't think it was ketchup based. The service was fine, aside from the gal taking a call while we ordered, in person, at the establishment. Maybe times are tough and gotta get those orders in. We won't be back. Time to find another local Thai place.

1viUCKIyxu3zkWvVcC1Bew.text: I love it here! Amazing food, the best doughnuts! It's also very beautiful inside. Friendly staff as well. Great for big parties since it's never a busy restaurant. They got the best Phad Thai

Fkd5_9ff0M5DiHNd3IUyPg.text: Great restaurant hidden in a strip mall on Independence. Not too hard to find but the strip mall has seen better days for sure. Longtime residents will remember the mall as TGI Fridays and Rock and Roll Emporium used to be located there. Stopped in the restaurant for lunch on a recommendation from a friend and I couldn't be more happy. The service was excellent, and the food tasted great with lots of authentic touches to the cuisine. A hidden gem that is sure to be well-received from lovers of Thai cuisine.

X4bx9_W6ecTrRGz_wGLUxg.text: Wow!! Im so happy this place is on my side of town! The owners, Terry and Megan, are kind and welcoming. The food is ON POINT, the real deal (not bs commercialized Thai). We ordered veggie & tofu pad thai, so sweet chicken, egg rolls and shrimp in a blanket. The apps were really well made and super flavorful. Our meal was to-go, and I love that the containers for the fried items had vents (so that they dont get soggy). My hubby said the shrimps in a blanket were unique, unlike anything he's ever had -- and they were delish. Our entrees were cooked to perfection and again, really authentic in flavor. Ill be back and plan to order everything on the menu before I circle back to my first awesom order :)! Thanks Terry & Megan, so happy youre here in Charlotte!!

me7Yrvr39T2IbI8dQvSrXA.text: This place is outstanding! Clean, great service and great food. Owners are awesome, engaged and want to provide great food and service! I travel around the country and its great to find a awesome spot! Keep up the great food and service!

q55nE5_aCtAY5Z-TRvGthQ.text: Went in for the first time today. The food was tasty, we had a gyoza app, I had Pad Thai with veggies and my bf had beef fried rice. The chunks of beef were a little large, but everything tasted great including the sample apps we were offered. Those curry puffs are so yummy! The lady working was super friendly and hospitable. I'll be going back soon.

4Gmb-a7qDeW5dBiiaBzNeg.text: Wow!  The Thai at Arroy is the best in CLT!

K7mRuFWYjyme1tiu7YA2tg.text: I believe this restaurant is at the same location where Fu Lin used to be. They did a good job in redecorating the place, 5 star for ambiance. We ordered Pad Thai with shrimp, papaya salad and tilapia with garlic2 sauce. The papaya salad has a good taste. $8.50 is little too expensive for shredded papaya. The pad Thai is too sweet and over cooked for us. In order to be eatable, we have to pour a lot of lime juice (2 star). As for the fish, i was expecting a whole tilapia fish. The taste is pretty good. It would be better if they would use less salt.  So disappointing that we still cannot find an authentic Thai food in CHARLOTTE.

h0AZe2nJz49bbgOfOoB0-w.text: I ordered from door dash because it gave the open to chose the level of spice. I ordered mild. My order was so spicy I could not eat it. I love Thai food but I don't like super spicy bc I get heartburn easily. Very disappointed that it was so incredibly spicy.

photos.caption: Photo of Aroy Thai Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Order ticket has mild listed - but my Pad See Ew was incredibly spicy I could not eat.

hZCZoEpt9meF4OiTsgTPlg.text: This review comes after my third time choosing Aroy Thai for dinner.   The young couple who own? manage? The place are really sweet and have a fun story and interacting with them on our first visit was a plus and the food was solid!  Some reviews complain that the food is served on plastic (and that's not too environmentally conscious) but my girlfriend actually liked that everything left uneaten was already to-go ready and maybe that model is cheaper for a newer restaurant than buying expensive flatware.   The second time I went I placed on order online through their website.  Apparently they had some issues with this ordering system and have since changed to a new system but on this occasion, their original site still accepted orders and so I got mine together, submitted and went to go pick it up.  Upon arrival, I learned that they had been having issues with that system and that my order had not been received but they would begin it at that time and so I waited for 20ish minutes on that.  I wasn't in a huge hurry, technical difficulties happen. When we got our order, 2 out of our 5 items was wrong.  The third time I tried to order online using the NEW system.  I placed my order, saw the 25 minute time estimate, signed up for text alerts about order progress and arrived at the restaurant 25 minutes later.  When I arrived, the door was closed and locked and a sheet of paper said "closed today for internet issues."   I tried the door just to check- maybe it was an issue processing credit cards in house but, since I had paid my order online and it had gone through, maybe they were still able to process it?    After I tried the door and went to the car to come up with a new food plan, I THEN received a text update that my order was canceled and the store was closed.  However, I had already driven all the way to the restaurant (20ish minutes one way).  So, that wasn't helpful...  I think maybe I've just been unlucky with Aroy Thai, but in each of the times where they was some issue with technology, the employees didn't seem too concerned about the inconvenience of waiting 20 minutes while they start an order that I thought would be prepared or driving 40 minutes that could have been avoided if they were monitoring their online site and could have messaged the the order was canceled BEFORE the pickup time, or if they had disabled online ordering since they were closed.  I understand that sometimes things happen but I was absolutely unimpressed at their desire/willingness to fix the issue or try to apologize for the inconvenience or to try to give some kind of incentive to come back.  I love when a place will give out a discount/coupon/free item or something just as a gesture when some unavoidable thing happens.     For me, the food isn't good enough for the customer service to be as poor as it has been.

C2u1kULYQrMIpo_fszypDw.text: Aroy Thai is dependable, consistent, always providing delicious Thai food. Don't be concerned about their neighbors- they are first class. Quality food, delicious taste, ... definitely a good choice for the best Asian/ Thai food around.

9mwQ8bGPVcsCnHKbKTg_qg.text: Think I found my new thai place. The prices here are comparable to other Thai restaurants. Honestly, it's been very difficult to find a decent thai place in the area and this is the closest to the one I had back in Raleigh. I ordered the tofu with panang curry. It was off the chain! The woman who took my order was super nice. It's a very casual restaurant. You have to order at the counter and they'll bring out the food. It was amazing.

CeXCtoZ_i3zAhUc9NuHo8w.text: Brand new restaurant.  Super neat and clean inside with cute decor.  It's nice to have a close Thai spot on East Charlotte located off the hwy.  Super friendly staff.  I loved the egg roll sauce which seemed like sheds of pineapple were in it.  The egg rolls were price but you get four for $5 and change.  That's starting to be the norm.  I hope they'll offer fresh spring rolls in the near future.  The chicken pad Thai was like any other Thai spot.  The spice was close to the crushed peanut side which snuck up on me although I ordered mild.

photos.caption: Photo of Aroy Thai Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken pad thai and spring rolls (4 per order)

zOqhEjRJw5yjQPRXAvsHlw.text: Just recently returned from a trip to Thailand, I was searching for a restaurant with authentic Thai food. So given that disclaimer I had a really good idea on what Thai food should taste. So one day driving down Independence I noticed the sign for Aroy Thai restaurant and decided to pull over and try out their traditional Pad Thai dish. As soon as I walked in I was greeted kindly and immediately felt welcomed.   I was told they had a to go style service which I'm not accustomed to but had no issues with it whatsoever. I ordered a mild spicy Pad Thai and a Thai iced tea. As I was waiting for the food I noticed the decor was very nice and cozy nothing fancy but just right the restaurant. When the food arrived at the table, (which didn't take long) I immediately felt like I was about to eat an authentic pad Thai dish and boy was I right!!   The level of spiciness was perfect for being a mild spicy pad Thai dish. The choice of ingredients were very similar to the ones I tried in Thailand. The Thai iced tea was delicious and the quality of service was extremely good, I couldn't have been more satisfied. As I was enjoying my pad Thai dish I was offered a curry puff appetizer to taste for being a first time customer which was delicious and a really nice gesture.   I would highly recommend Aroy Thai restaurant to anyone who is looking for authentic Thai food and Thai hospitality in the Matthews area. Try their curry puffs and shrimp shumai appetizers for starters, followed by Pad See Ew or their famous Pad Thai dish for an entree accompanied by a delicious Thai tea. I hope everyone has the same enjoyable experience I had while eating at this restaurant. Cheers!

51qjYhWegJCBkbdt8Em3Ig.text: Great new casual Thai place! The food was outstanding, fresh and authentic. We had the Curry Puffs, Crab Rangoon, Papaya Salad and the Red Curry. Each dish was fresh with just the right amount of spice.   The owner was very nice and helpful! We will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Aroy Thai Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Aroy Thai Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

fqO4JntWU0ORtucy4uhrJg.text: A few weeks ago I order Pad Thai from here...It was absolutely amazing and all I could think about was the next opportunity to order from here again. Well I did, and again I ordered the Pad Thai. Only this time the noodles were very dry and the meal tasted a bit weird. I'm not sure what's changed in the kitchen in a matter of 2 weeks but I am not looking forward to eating food from here anytime soon.

fkJJ_SB65zOnKCCZNfAISA.text: Not your typical restaurant set-up, but still a good experience.  This Thai restaurant is hidden in a shopping plaza with lots of room for parking.  This small restaurant is modernly decorated with a few indoor tables. They seat you with menus and when you are ready you walk up to the counter, order, and pay.  My only complaint is that food is served in plastic (I am not a big fan of that but if you don't mind then you'll have a wonderful experience).  The food was good! We had crab rangoons (SO GOOD) and the shrimp blankets as an appetizer.  For dinner, I had the Kom Kha Ka soup (may have spelled that wrong) which is a zesty soup with lemongrass and mushrooms.

M7hLEujzuB60GNPl2H4BRQ.text: It was very Unfortunate. first owner sold this place to other owner. The food doesn't taste same anymore. I'm very sad and unexpected. The first owner have to leave town. I really LOVE their Thai food; one of my favorite place in Charlotte. In the future, I Hope they doing well, and I hope one day see you guy again. My wife and I really love the taste of Aroy Thai.

sbqKQ96r6iEd8wuG1cfemw.text: Updated review. I went back to this place to order my beloved shrimp pad thai and it was nowhere near the same recipe as before. It tasted and looked completely different, and there was a lack of shrimp in the dish. The portion size was also much smaller while the cost remained the same. I loved this place, but unfortunately I will not be returning.

QV9hXewoph3UWlwu3Bm38w.text: To be from a family that has spent a lot of time in Thailand, I was skeptical at first. Upon arrival, we found a cute, clean restaurant, excellent & attentive service; AND the BEST Thai food we've had outside of Thailand itself. The lunch specials (even on a Saturday) were well-priced and great portions. We tried Panang, Green Curry & Red Curry; and between us had medium, spicy and Thai hot levels of spice. Everything was fresh & delicious. Also tied the Thai iced tea which was delicious. We're already planning our next visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Aroy Thai Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Aroy Thai Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Aroy Thai Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

_PS1am7MLTNHcrC-6j4J5A.text: Hands down best Thai I've ever had.   I absolutely love this place, it is True authentic Thai  with amazing friendly people, great service, and food that is unmatched. I would highly recommend the pad Thai, it's definitely one of my favorites.

rNS5ZkUXvotTQzFo5n_2DA.text: This is my new favorite place for Thai food. They are thoroughly explain if you are the first customer. They offer free crab ragoon. Basil is my go to place for Pad Thai but this exceeded my expectations and Bsasil. My boyfriend had red curry and it was delicious. The curry have the right amount of cream and spice and the veggies was fresh. The place is small but cozy. For the food you get the price is reasonable. I will definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Aroy Thai Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pad thai and red curry
Photo of Aroy Thai Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

4-RBSzYu9fA9cIo4LrVAxA.text: If it matters and it shouldn't I ordered thru Door Dash. At best it was ok food from the freezer. I ordered the Shumi, very tiny and not made in house. They are about the size of a thimble. Next pork dumplings, 4 big meatballs with a wonton wrapper around the bottom. Last was the seafood fried rice. I didn't expect to bite into the shells on the small shrimp. 2 mussels in shell shell also. It's was more like regular rice with some soy added for color. I gave the star because the serving size of the rice was excellent even though I'm not so sure I'll be eating it. Maybe eating in house makes a big difference. I'll not be finding out anytime soon.

Xd4fLr5RCIZaAb3cf1XSDA.text: Atmosphere was great, I ordered to go for my lunch break. I loved how nice they were, the food was very tasty and a good portion for the lunch menu. Also included two pot stickers. I would definitely be back to try some other items I had the pad Thai .

AKUyZgV6sK0F5sJlvpA_Lg.text: A great hidden gem. Ordered the Tom Yum Soup which was excellent. I also ordered the Pad Thai chicken which was very good. The restaurant was very clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful. I'd definitely stop by here again if ever in the area.

XcJnj1Lal6IJOP1fXlLkjA.text: Excellent food, SUPER friendly staff. Definitely try the fried pork dumplings sooo good!! Larb was great and my husband loved the pad Thai. Generous portions

photos.caption: Photo of Aroy Thai Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pad Thai, my husband tried Thai food for the first time in about 9 years (only had it once before) and he loved it.
Photo of Aroy Thai Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Larb, excellent low carb choice for dining out. Love that you can choose your spice level
Photo of Aroy Thai Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried pork dumplings. Fantastic. Barely got the picture in before I finished eating them

n4QKti0YsaAH6Q59npls6g.text: My boyfriend read about this gem in the Charlotte Agenda and we were super excited to try it. It did not disappoint! We went for lunch during the week and although we were the only seated guests, a few people came in for take-out during our time there. From the moment we entered, you could tell the owners were passionate about what they do and the customer service was top of the line-especially for a casual restaurant.   You order and pay at the desk, but then the food is brought to you. I ordered the Ultimate Garlic Lunch Special with Chicken-Mild Spicy and my boyfriend got the Sweet and Sour Lunch Special with Chicken-Hot. They also let us sample the Crab Rangoon's since it was our first visit. We both really enjoyed our meals. The only thing we didn't love were the Rangoon's (too much cream cheese, in my opinion) but they were free, so who's complaining?  All in all, it's very exciting to have this spot on the east side, and we may take advantage of the carry-out in the future.

5DOejNaaj5sV0jDyyXMcZg.text: I've been wanting to try Aroy for a long time and because it's not close to wear I live it's taken me a while to get there. I went in for lunch and was more than impressed with how delicious the food is and how friendly the service was!   They have a lunch special, but my Thai favorite Pad See Ew wasn't on the list. I was still able to order it and I ate every bite! It was really good!   The restaurant itself it decorated with a slight farm house feel which is interesting, but cute.   The only thing I didn't love was all of the disposable materials. It's not grate for our planet.

photos.caption: Photo of Aroy Thai Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Aroy Thai Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pad See Ew with Beef

2f_09ZbYQZREtotpCs4S3w.text: WHAT A DISAPPOINTMENT.  This used to be our favorite Thai place in Charlotte, and WOW did it ever change.    They closed down for a couple of weeks for "renovations" -- okay, fair enough.  Then, we come to learn that it's under new management, and that they're bringing in a new chef.  This made us nervous, but little did we know what we were in for.  What used to be huge portions of delicious food became minimalist takeout portions of food nowhere near as good as what it used to be.  What used to be the sweetest woman on the phone turned into a man that couldn't be more impolite.  On top of everything else, they stopped taking DoorDash orders, which is where we'd order Aroy at least once a week.  They took everything we loved about this business, and did exactly the opposite.  What.  A.  Shame.  It used to be such a gem.  Time to find a new Thai place, I suppose.

kmjOADkUkg9b9rtmBmzvHQ.text: Not sure how this place has 4 1/2 stars.... The place it was located was shady, the inside wasn't welcoming! To be honest, we were scared to go inside but we did anyways bc of the food reviews!!   We ate there and our food was served in plastic plates!  My flat rice noodles with veggies and tofu was ok! I was so hungry that I ate it but I wouldn't go back there again. Neither my brother or sister in law were happy with their food.

QJbChVjMtBWN9avkcQHDNA.text: My first time checking this place out and it did not disappoint me. The Pad Thai was flavorful. I highly recommend this restaurant.

dJjYSE7JxQBJ8Aaxy3vu4Q.text: I had been wanting to try this place for a long time. It is right near my house, so a perfect place to stop by when I'm near home. It's really more of a take out restaurant than a sit down restaurant. Thy do have tables available to sit, but you order at the counter and then they will bring it out if you choose to eat there.   The pad Thai (medium spice) was pretty good. I asked for extra spices to add later if I needed to (which I did). There could've been more of the pad Thai sauce on it, it was a tad dry.  The staff was really nice. I would come back again. It's literally within walking distance to my house. So it's very convenient.

photos.caption: Photo of Aroy Thai Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pad Thai

mfCmLKKq9h3q3MLOagJH_Q.text: Not your regular Thai restaurant. We were the only te their besides the staff, which provide a more intimate experience. We sampled various Thai Ice Tea flavors they have to offer while watching a Thai version of American Idol on the tv. Our waitress was by far one of the most friendly individuals I have ever met. Our food tasted authentic and fresh. They are located in a shopping center off of Independence so be mindful not to pass them on accident.

photos.caption: Photo of Aroy Thai Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Green Thai Tea sample
Photo of Aroy Thai Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

r2e3SOkb3TYiRdsGcz497g.text: This place was a random treat my best friend and I found on a trip to a store close by. We didn't expect it to be as good as it was and for the decor cute. I love how the place is decorated and how the food is given to you. I just love the overall vibe of this place. The price is also great. This place truly is a "hole in the wall". I would definitely go back if I am in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Aroy Thai Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Decor
Photo of Aroy Thai Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. She got Pad Thai. I got Pad See Ew.

dEli02iQKc7PfmOoQgmUEA.text: It seems like a never ending parade of places I've been to that have been something else (likely more than one something else).  In this case, Aroy Thai keep things simple - generally a good idea. You come in and order at the counter (another idea that seems to be spreading) and a short while later your food is delivered.  The staff is friendly, and while the space is small, it is nice. Though they have plastic utensils at the serve-yourself area, they will deliver the regular/silver kind when they bring your food.  One thing that is a bit odd is the portion size. With one dish, a large ball of rice and some veggies. With another - a more traditional pad thai - a rather large plate.  Nothing wrong with it, exactly, and likely that the veggies cost more. It's just a bit of a stark difference when they sit next to each other is all. The quality of the food is certainly tasty.

e9soX9UmLitltYWyRekA9Q.text: Nice to see a new Thai place open up.   This place is different than your normal sit down Thai place. You sit down anywhere. There's only about 8 tables so you don't have too many choices. They bring you a menu and then you go to the counter to order.   Everything comes on disposable plates and cups so you also clean up after yourself.   Th menu has traditional Thai dishes with creative adjectives. I went with what I usually get to sample a Thai menu - lovely basil with chicken. Lunch also came with 2 potstickers. I also ordered brown rice which was $1 more.   The dish was good. Nice flavors and tender chicken. I ordered Thai spicy and while it had a good heat to it, the spice was also flavorful but didn't linger like I normally like.   The staff was great. Super friendly and helpful and also gracious for me coming in.  It's an interesting way to do things and probably because they are new. The food is good and was definitely worth stopping.

Jwr5AoQEK3E7fzkWmC8Yyw.text: So me and a couple of my friends had wanted too try this thai restaurant Aroy thai on east independence for the frist time. When we got there it was a nice looking place the service was great and the food was the best I had ever tasted and for me it tasted real Authentic. For me I had the Panang Curry my new favorite item which the manger had recommended that I try and my friends had gotten the Pad thai. It was an amazing experience that I had everyone was great the owners and one of the manger thomas. I would recommend this place too everyone and anyone that loves asian food especially if it is thai food. I come almost everyday now to order the curry and I also try to do something different evertime. Next time I will try the Pad See Ew which I hear is amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Aroy Thai Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Panang Curry

cB8IGZxMpY4YuRbUyJ-r1g.text: I was excited to try this new Thai restaurant in town. Unfortunately the food didn't lift up to my expectations of authentic Thai food.  We ordered a papaya salad (3 stars), a shrimp Pad Thai (1 star) and Deep Fried Tilapia with garlic sauce (3 stars). The papaya salad is pretty good, but pricey for a salad without any shrimp in it. The Pad Thai is a major disappointment. Not only it's way too sweet, but also the noodle was too soft! We had to ask for fresh lime and drenched it the lime for the Pad Thai to be edible. The only decent dish was the deep fried Tapia with garlic sauce.   I can only give 2 stars for the food and 3 starts for the Service and ambiance. Sad to give an overall 3 stars for this new Thai restaurant in town:(

photos.caption: Photo of Aroy Thai Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Papaya Salad
Photo of Aroy Thai Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp Pad Thai (too sweet and the noodle is too soft)
Photo of Aroy Thai Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Deep fried Tilapias with garlic sauce

uHJYfnAbeZCCzVqwLBRX1w.text: This review is for the new owners. I'm sad to say that this place is no longer the same. The quality AND quantity of food is less.   The Tom yum soup that I loved so much tasted watery and not as intense of flavors as it was before. The Pad Thai is still ok. The lovely basil beef was pretty sad, comparing to the original version. The portion looks like it should've been for lunch instead of dinner.   I thought I'd give the new owners a second chance before writing a review, but a second chance they failed. Sad to say goodbye because we will not be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Aroy Thai Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dinner- $11 Lovely Basil beef from new owners.
Photo of Aroy Thai Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Aroy Thai Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

Nv_88O09Qji6DdxeJHGIMA.text: Sadly things have changed at Aroy since there are now new owners. The quality of the food has definitely declined, as has the portion size.   On the latest visit, the power was shut to the restaurant, though they still finished cooking the meals as they were using gas. The neighboring businesses in the center still had power.   They've also put up a sign that is less than customer friendly. Sorry Aroy, I wish you were back to your old self. And ownership.

photos.caption: Photo of Aroy Thai Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Service refusal sign = sad.

ciZOiU70Rf4fQa6704n_ew.text: Two days after writing my review and I already need to update so I can add some more fun facts and tid-bits.   Yet another fabulous strip mall gem on Independence Boulevard. This one is tucked away in the Independence Promenade shopping center (other businesses here include The Red Door, Crazy Horse, Neck Breakers, and Hispanic grocery superstore Supermercado La Unica).  Originally, they were just going to open a take out spot. They wanted to provide people with affordable, quality food. When they saw that the space was bigger than they had thought, they decided to add dining. They've decorated really well. It's cute and cozy. You feel like you're eating at someone's house. It still has the take-out feel. You order and pay at the counter, then your food is brought out to your table.  Your food is served on disposable plates.  There are lunch specials every day from 11am-3pm, $7.95-$9.95 depending on your protein. Each come with two pieces of gyoza. The Totally Red Curry is their best seller. I've tried the Pad Thai with chicken, Ginger & Bell with shrimp, Sweet & Sour shrimp, and the Tom Kha Kai soup (comfort in a bowl). Appetizer-wise, the curry puffs are delicious. Even if you don't like curry, you'll like this. It's not a lot of curry, so it doesn't hit you in the face. The thai iced tea is dangerous (I say that because I could easily drink a gallon of it). Note: you can order pickup online on their website. There is also Doordash delivery for a limited area.   The owners are so sweet. You'll usually find Meghan behind the counter. My first visit, she fully explained the menu, walked us through the process of ordering and dining. Since it was our first time there, she brought us each a fried donut with a condensed milk dipping sauce. So good. My next visit, she remembered my first visit, even down to where we were sitting and what my lunch companion was wearing. Amazing.   Support this great local business!

EgyGa3xNli7mZDr0dk1_hQ.text: Order at the counter and pay before you eat. Big sign, "all sales final, NO Refunds.  Only utensils are plastic-ware and chop sticks.  No beer here which I really like with Thai. I ordered my dish extra spicy and extra Basel, it came with neither. That being said, it is tasted and worth my $15.  Service I cannot review since there is none.  I drove 20 miles to get here not knowing the area. If I knew then what I know now I would not have made the drive. Worth a stop if you're driving by

P2H0NHbPzb1yB1w0MPl3Mg.text: Sweet service and spicy food! A small group from my office decided to check out Aroy on Friday afternoon for lunch. We were greeted by the sweetest hostess who immediately pushed two tables together for our party of five and brought us menus, explaining that you order at the front counter and then they bring the food to you. The restaurant itself is really cozy. It almost feels like a country-style, home cooking place rather than a Thai restaurant, but no complaints about that here!   For lunch, I went with the Totally Red Curry, medium spicy, with chicken and added veggies for $1 more. The lunch portion is huge and comes with two pork gyoza and white rice. (All for $12 WITH tip, y'all. Such a great deal!) The medium spice level was perfect for me! It had some heat but also didn't burn my face off. They have five levels from no spice on one end to Thai spicy on the other. Not going to lie, Thai spicy terrifies me.    Every one else in my group ordered the Pad Thai with various takes on the protein and spice level. Each variety looked delicious. I may try the tofu next time! One particularly kind friend shared a bit of her Thai Iced Tea with me. Holy cow, y'all! Hook me up to an IV and just pump that stuff into me 24-7. It is like crack! Sweet and creamy but with a fresh, light tea flavor at the same time. I'm hooked!   After our meal, the lovely hostess was kind enough to bring us a complementary dessert of fried dough and a condensed milk dipping sauce. It was the perfect sweet ending to the meal, cooling down my mouth which was a little tingly from my medium spice curry at that point.   We are excited to have Aroy so close by our East. Charlotte office! When you work off Idlewild Road, you sort of resign yourself to being in a good restaurant desert. However, with the addition of Cooking Pot and now Aroy Thai, things have been looking up for our little neighborhood recently!

photos.caption: Photo of Aroy Thai Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red curry lunch special with chicken and veggies (just $1 extra to add the veggies; comes with rice and gyoza

dJZF2DQ5HXpEBlnruU5ckg.text: Not my favorite location to drive to because it's not easy to get to driving east on independence. Food is good tho. I ordered the Pad Thai veggie with mild spice and it was great!

_6zWVpZ-kbSAgX6O5JBDWQ.text: I liked it.  The younger female who works there is very accommodating and wants everyone to be happy. I was happy for the most part, especially with my red curry dish.  I was not overly thrilled that we had to order our meal at the counter.  I was not thrilled that they didn't have brewed iced tea, though they made me some hot tea and put ice in it.  I was not thrilled that I had to go get my silverware and my sweetener for  tea.  The other lady who works there walked over to the shelf where they were and told me that I could get my Sweet and Low there.  She was standing right next to those pink packets and could have so easily offered to bring me one!   The atmosphere makes it seem like it's a farm house. There was nothing about it that made you feel that you were in a Thai place!  It was eerily quiet.   The location is a bit dicey.  It is in a strip center next to a strip club!  Gives new meaning to a strip center, huh?   All in all, good food. Nice people.  Just nothing to make me jump up and down, but still good.    This part of town probably needed a restaurant like this, so I give them a big shout out for adding Thai flavor to the neighborhood. Besides, a good Thai meal before the strip show next door would make any hungry man happy, right?

photos.caption: Photo of Aroy Thai Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Aroy Thai Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red Curry.
Photo of Aroy Thai Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

kmnQGYkIy7okIAucZ1Zd-Q.text: I was excited to try this place given the glowing reviews.  Unfortunately, it left me disappointed.    I found it a bit weird that we had to order at the counter and we felt rushed.    We started with a couple of apps which were simply poor.  Trader Joe's frozen pot stickers and dumplings are better.  Pretty much felt like a rip off.    We got one curry dish and one noodle dish.  Both were Ok.  Just Ok.    There's simply no reason for me to every go back to this restaurant.

_bYzq7RIu5CzSWsPbpMQ4g.text: What a hidden gem!  My husband and I recently moved to Mint Hill from Washington DC and were looking for good Thai food, close to our house.  Don't let the location deter you!  It's located between what looked like a strip club and a lingerie store, but the restaurant is clean and immaculately decorated inside.    You get menus at your table and order at the window at the front of the restaurant.  I loved the casual feel but upscale atmosphere.  We shared the crab Rangoon (one of their specialties!) and both had the combination pad Thai.  Both dishes were excellent!  I've been to Thailand and eaten tons of authentic Thai food in DC and this was up there with the best.  The food came out piping hot and fresh and the flavor was delicious.  They also brought it samples of their curry puffs, which they said were another one of their specialties.  The husband and wife team running the restaurant were so nice and we had such a fun time chatting with them.  We can't wait to go back and try other dishes!

photos.caption: Photo of Aroy Thai Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

05U3mfP6_lNyPuDi-qKikg.text: This place is awesome!  Great food and the chicken pad Thai is to die for.  My wife brought some home that I finished and we had to go back in 3 days since it was that great.

tTqQcWWApnYvEsClbsUKeg.text: My husband and I moved to Charlotte about a year ago and began the search for a go to Thai place. We drove twenty minutes from our house to try out this place and we were not disappointed! We absolutely love Thai food and Aroy Thai served us the best Pad Thai we ever had. By far the best Thai place we tried here in Charlotte. Not only was the food amazing, the staff was so kind and attending and the atmosphere of the restaurant is very cute and modern. We will most definitely be returning.

8KZKKgWKgibrltrymiYwFw.text: It's great to have a reasonably priced Thai restaurant in the Charlotte area. Aroy Thai is in a strip mall on Independence Boulevard. It's a very simple restaurant, small with a few tables but very serene atmosphere. The servers are so nice and helpful. I had the Pad Thai and the shrimp yellow curry and they were both really good. The portion sizes were huge. I'm looking forward to making this my new hangout for Thai food.

83ZJIfThwixsT2JHM5tb1A.text: Tried this new local spot today (for takeout) & was pleasantly surprised! Had the pork dumplings and cashew chicken - both very good. Don't let the sketchy shopping center deter you, it's worth a visit.

cK19G9UJjT5ooWnBt-e1XQ.text: Finally!!!  A nice little Thai place in Charlotte on my side of town!!!  Everything I've gotten here has been great!  It is basically a super nice takeout place with a really nicely decorated dining area if you want to dine in.  You order at the counter and they bring it out to you.  The owners are awesome!

Kus6LoQqVl1bx-Rz6iAndg.text: Green curry is delicious! Not a fan of the Thai tea, have had it much better other places. Food and service was excellent!!
